description: Returns information about one SLO created in the account.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: The ARN or name of the SLO that you want to retrieve information about. You can find the ARNs of SLOs by using the ListServiceLevelObjectives operation.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The ARN of this SLO.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of this SLO.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The description that you created for this SLO.

nested_items.name: CreatedTime
nested_items.description: The date and time that this SLO was created. When used in a raw HTTP Query API, it is formatted as yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss. For example, 2019-07-01T23:59:59.

nested_items.name: LastUpdatedTime
nested_items.description: The time that this SLO was most recently updated. When used in a raw HTTP Query API, it is formatted as yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss. For example, 2019-07-01T23:59:59.

nested_items.name: SliMetric
nested_items.description: A structure that contains information about the metric that the SLO monitors.

nested_items.name: KeyAttributes
nested_items.description: This is a string-to-string map that contains information about the type of object that this SLO is related to. It can include the following fields.
Type designates the type of object that this SLO is related to.
ResourceType specifies the type of the resource. This field is used only when the value of the Type field is Resource or AWS::Resource.
Name specifies the name of the object. This is used only if the value of the Type field is Service, RemoteService, or AWS::Service.
Identifier identifies the resource objects of this resource. This is used only if the value of the Type field is Resource or AWS::Resource.
Environment specifies the location where this object is hosted, or what it belongs to.

nested_items.name: OperationName
nested_items.description: If the SLO monitors a specific operation of the service, this field displays that operation name.

nested_items.name: MetricType
nested_items.description: If the SLO monitors either the LATENCY or AVAILABILITY metric that Application Signals collects, this field displays which of those metrics is used.

nested_items.name: MetricDataQueries
nested_items.description: If this SLO monitors a CloudWatch metric or the result of a CloudWatch metric math expression, this structure includes the information about that metric or expression.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: A short name used to tie this object to the results in the response. This Id must be unique within a MetricDataQueries array. If you are performing math expressions on this set of data, this name represents that data and can serve as a variable in the metric math expression. The valid characters are letters, numbers, and underscore. The first character must be a lowercase letter.

nested_items.name: MetricStat
nested_items.description: A metric to be used directly for the SLO, or to be used in the math expression that will be used for the SLO.

nested_items.name: Namespace
nested_items.description: The namespace of the metric. For more information, see Namespaces.

nested_items.name: MetricName
nested_items.description: The name of the metric to use.

nested_items.name: Dimensions
nested_items.description: An array of one or more dimensions to use to define the metric that you want to use. For more information, see Dimensions.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the dimension. Dimension names must contain only ASCII characters, must include at least one non-whitespace character, and cannot start with a colon ( :). ASCII control characters are not supported as part of dimension names.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the dimension. Dimension values must contain only ASCII characters and must include at least one non-whitespace character. ASCII control characters are not supported as part of dimension values.

nested_items.name: Period
nested_items.description: The granularity, in seconds, to be used for the metric. For metrics with regular resolution, a period can be as short as one minute (60 seconds) and must be a multiple of 60. For high-resolution metrics that are collected at intervals of less than one minute, the period can be 1, 5, 10, 30, 60, or any multiple of 60. High-resolution metrics are those metrics stored by a PutMetricData call that includes a StorageResolution of 1 second.

nested_items.name: Stat
nested_items.description: The statistic to use for comparison to the threshold. It can be any CloudWatch statistic or extended statistic. For more information about statistics, see CloudWatch statistics definitions.

nested_items.name: Unit
nested_items.description: If you omit Unit then all data that was collected with any unit is returned, along with the corresponding units that were specified when the data was reported to CloudWatch. If you specify a unit, the operation returns only data that was collected with that unit specified. If you specify a unit that does not match the data collected, the results of the operation are null. CloudWatch does not perform unit conversions.

nested_items.name: Expression
nested_items.description: This field can contain a metric math expression to be performed on the other metrics that you are retrieving within this MetricDataQueries structure.

nested_items.name: Label
nested_items.description: A human-readable label for this metric or expression. This is especially useful if this is an expression, so that you know what the value represents. If the metric or expression is shown in a CloudWatch dashboard widget, the label is shown. If Label is omitted, CloudWatch generates a default.

nested_items.name: ReturnData
nested_items.description: Use this only if you are using a metric math expression for the SLO. Specify true for ReturnData for only the one expression result to use as the alarm. For all other metrics and expressions in the same CreateServiceLevelObjective operation, specify ReturnData as false.

nested_items.name: Period
nested_items.description: The granularity, in seconds, of the returned data points for this metric. For metrics with regular resolution, a period can be as short as one minute (60 seconds) and must be a multiple of 60. For high-resolution metrics that are collected at intervals of less than one minute, the period can be 1, 5, 10, 30, 60, or any multiple of 60. High-resolution metrics are those metrics stored by a PutMetricData call that includes a StorageResolution of 1 second.
Start time between 3 hours and 15 days ago - Use a multiple of 60 seconds (1 minute).
Start time between 15 and 63 days ago - Use a multiple of 300 seconds (5 minutes).
Start time greater than 63 days ago - Use a multiple of 3600 seconds (1 hour).

nested_items.name: AccountId
nested_items.description: The ID of the account where this metric is located. If you are performing this operation in a monitoring account, use this to specify which source account to retrieve this metric from.

nested_items.name: DependencyConfig
nested_items.description: Identifies the dependency using the DependencyKeyAttributes and DependencyOperationName.

nested_items.name: DependencyKeyAttributes
nested_items.description: This is a string-to-string map. It can include the following fields.
Type designates the type of object this is.
ResourceType specifies the type of the resource. This field is used only when the value of the Type field is Resource or AWS::Resource.
Name specifies the name of the object. This is used only if the value of the Type field is Service, RemoteService, or AWS::Service.
Identifier identifies the resource objects of this resource. This is used only if the value of the Type field is Resource or AWS::Resource.
Environment specifies the location where this object is hosted, or what it belongs to.

nested_items.name: DependencyOperationName
nested_items.description: The name of the called operation in the dependency.

nested_items.name: MetricThreshold
nested_items.description: The value that the SLI metric is compared to.

nested_items.name: ComparisonOperator
nested_items.description: The arithmetic operation used when comparing the specified metric to the threshold.

nested_items.name: RequestBasedSli
nested_items.description: A structure containing information about the performance metric that this SLO monitors, if this is a request-based SLO.

nested_items.name: RequestBasedSliMetric
nested_items.description: A structure that contains information about the metric that the SLO monitors.

nested_items.name: KeyAttributes
nested_items.description: This is a string-to-string map that contains information about the type of object that this SLO is related to. It can include the following fields.
Type designates the type of object that this SLO is related to.
ResourceType specifies the type of the resource. This field is used only when the value of the Type field is Resource or AWS::Resource.
Name specifies the name of the object. This is used only if the value of the Type field is Service, RemoteService, or AWS::Service.
Identifier identifies the resource objects of this resource. This is used only if the value of the Type field is Resource or AWS::Resource.
Environment specifies the location where this object is hosted, or what it belongs to.

nested_items.name: OperationName
nested_items.description: If the SLO monitors a specific operation of the service, this field displays that operation name.

nested_items.name: MetricType
nested_items.description: If the SLO monitors either the LATENCY or AVAILABILITY metric that Application Signals collects, this field displays which of those metrics is used.

nested_items.name: TotalRequestCountMetric
nested_items.description: This structure defines the metric that is used as the 'total requests' number for a request-based SLO. The number observed for this metric is divided by the number of 'good requests' or 'bad requests' that is observed for the metric defined in MonitoredRequestCountMetric.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: A short name used to tie this object to the results in the response. This Id must be unique within a MetricDataQueries array. If you are performing math expressions on this set of data, this name represents that data and can serve as a variable in the metric math expression. The valid characters are letters, numbers, and underscore. The first character must be a lowercase letter.

nested_items.name: MetricStat
nested_items.description: A metric to be used directly for the SLO, or to be used in the math expression that will be used for the SLO.

nested_items.name: Namespace
nested_items.description: The namespace of the metric. For more information, see Namespaces.

nested_items.name: MetricName
nested_items.description: The name of the metric to use.

nested_items.name: Dimensions
nested_items.description: An array of one or more dimensions to use to define the metric that you want to use. For more information, see Dimensions.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the dimension. Dimension names must contain only ASCII characters, must include at least one non-whitespace character, and cannot start with a colon ( :). ASCII control characters are not supported as part of dimension names.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the dimension. Dimension values must contain only ASCII characters and must include at least one non-whitespace character. ASCII control characters are not supported as part of dimension values.

nested_items.name: Period
nested_items.description: The granularity, in seconds, to be used for the metric. For metrics with regular resolution, a period can be as short as one minute (60 seconds) and must be a multiple of 60. For high-resolution metrics that are collected at intervals of less than one minute, the period can be 1, 5, 10, 30, 60, or any multiple of 60. High-resolution metrics are those metrics stored by a PutMetricData call that includes a StorageResolution of 1 second.

nested_items.name: Stat
nested_items.description: The statistic to use for comparison to the threshold. It can be any CloudWatch statistic or extended statistic. For more information about statistics, see CloudWatch statistics definitions.

nested_items.name: Unit
nested_items.description: If you omit Unit then all data that was collected with any unit is returned, along with the corresponding units that were specified when the data was reported to CloudWatch. If you specify a unit, the operation returns only data that was collected with that unit specified. If you specify a unit that does not match the data collected, the results of the operation are null. CloudWatch does not perform unit conversions.

nested_items.name: Expression
nested_items.description: This field can contain a metric math expression to be performed on the other metrics that you are retrieving within this MetricDataQueries structure.

nested_items.name: Label
nested_items.description: A human-readable label for this metric or expression. This is especially useful if this is an expression, so that you know what the value represents. If the metric or expression is shown in a CloudWatch dashboard widget, the label is shown. If Label is omitted, CloudWatch generates a default.

nested_items.name: ReturnData
nested_items.description: Use this only if you are using a metric math expression for the SLO. Specify true for ReturnData for only the one expression result to use as the alarm. For all other metrics and expressions in the same CreateServiceLevelObjective operation, specify ReturnData as false.

nested_items.name: Period
nested_items.description: The granularity, in seconds, of the returned data points for this metric. For metrics with regular resolution, a period can be as short as one minute (60 seconds) and must be a multiple of 60. For high-resolution metrics that are collected at intervals of less than one minute, the period can be 1, 5, 10, 30, 60, or any multiple of 60. High-resolution metrics are those metrics stored by a PutMetricData call that includes a StorageResolution of 1 second.
Start time between 3 hours and 15 days ago - Use a multiple of 60 seconds (1 minute).
Start time between 15 and 63 days ago - Use a multiple of 300 seconds (5 minutes).
Start time greater than 63 days ago - Use a multiple of 3600 seconds (1 hour).

nested_items.name: AccountId
nested_items.description: The ID of the account where this metric is located. If you are performing this operation in a monitoring account, use this to specify which source account to retrieve this metric from.

nested_items.name: MonitoredRequestCountMetric
nested_items.description: This structure defines the metric that is used as the 'good request' or 'bad request' value for a request-based SLO. This value observed for the metric defined in TotalRequestCountMetric is divided by the number found for MonitoredRequestCountMetric to determine the percentage of successful requests that this SLO tracks.

nested_items.name: GoodCountMetric
nested_items.description: If you want to count 'good requests' to determine the percentage of successful requests for this request-based SLO, specify the metric to use as 'good requests' in this structure.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: A short name used to tie this object to the results in the response. This Id must be unique within a MetricDataQueries array. If you are performing math expressions on this set of data, this name represents that data and can serve as a variable in the metric math expression. The valid characters are letters, numbers, and underscore. The first character must be a lowercase letter.

nested_items.description: The granularity, in seconds, of the returned data points for this metric. For metrics with regular resolution, a period can be as short as one minute (60 seconds) and must be a multiple of 60. For high-resolution metrics that are collected at intervals of less than one minute, the period can be 1, 5, 10, 30, 60, or any multiple of 60. nested_items.name: DependencyConfig
nested_items.description: Identifies the dependency using the DependencyKeyAttributes and DependencyOperationName.

nested_items.name: DependencyKeyAttributes
nested_items.description: This is a string-to-string map. It can include the following fields.
Type designates the type of object this is.
ResourceType specifies the type of the resource. This field is used only when the value of the Type field is Resource or AWS::Resource.
Name specifies the name of the object. This is used only if the value of the Type field is Service, RemoteService, or AWS::Service.
Identifier identifies the resource objects of this resource. This is used only if the value of the Type field is Resource or AWS::Resource.
Environment specifies the location where this object is hosted, or what it belongs to.

nested_items.name: DependencyOperationName
nested_items.description: The name of the called operation in the dependency.

nested_items.name: MetricThreshold
nested_items.description: This value is the threshold that the observed metric values of the SLI metric are compared to.

nested_items.name: ComparisonOperator
nested_items.description: The arithmetic operation used when comparing the specified metric to the threshold.

nested_items.name: EvaluationType
nested_items.description: Displays whether this is a period-based SLO or a request-based SLO.

nested_items.name: RollingInterval
nested_items.description: If the interval is a rolling interval, this structure contains the interval specifications.

nested_items.name: DurationUnit
nested_items.description: Specifies the rolling interval unit.

nested_items.name: Duration
nested_items.description: Specifies the duration of each rolling interval. For example, if Duration is 7 and DurationUnit is DAY, each rolling interval is seven days.

nested_items.name: CalendarInterval
nested_items.description: If the interval is a calendar interval, this structure contains the interval specifications.

nested_items.name: StartTime
nested_items.description: The date and time when you want the first interval to start. Be sure to choose a time that configures the intervals the way that you want. For example, if you want weekly intervals starting on Mondays at 6 a.m., be sure to specify a start time that is a Monday at 6 a.m.

nested_items.name: DurationUnit
nested_items.description: Specifies the calendar interval unit.

nested_items.name: Duration
nested_items.description: Specifies the duration of each calendar interval. For example, if Duration is 1 and DurationUnit is MONTH, each interval is one month, aligned with the calendar.

nested_items.name: AttainmentGoal
nested_items.description: The threshold that determines if the goal is being met.

nested_items.name: WarningThreshold
nested_items.description: The percentage of remaining budget over total budget that you want to get warnings for. If you omit this parameter, the default of 50.0 is used.

nested_items.name: BurnRateConfigurations
nested_items.description: Each object in this array defines the length of the look-back window used to calculate one burn rate metric for this SLO. The burn rate measures how fast the service is consuming the error budget, relative to the attainment goal of the SLO.

nested_items.name: LookBackWindowMinutes
nested_items.description: The number of minutes to use as the look-back window.

nested_items.name: MetricSourceType
nested_items.description: Displays the SLI metric source type for this SLO. Supported types are:
Service operation.
Service dependency.
CloudWatch metric.
